name: Asilomar Beach House! Aquarium Passes!
description:
Spacious 5 bedroom home within walking distance to the beach im coastal zone. Take long walks on the beach, dine at five star Pebble Beach and Carmel restaurants, and explore 17 mile drive! Please message us on Airbandb for more information regarding dates, availability, and pricing. Minimum 30 day stays per city guidelines.

The space
Our home has been lovingly updated!The bottom floor is open concept, with a large comfy couch in the primary living space, a spacious kitchen with large island, and a smaller living space off of the kitchen. The large accordion French doors open onto the deck and beautiful back yard where oak trees and Monterey Pines abound. We love sipping wine on the deck in the evenings and listening to the waves crash in the distance! Guests have access to two outdoor propane heaters and a gas powered outdoor fireplace for when the coastal fog rolls in at night. There is also an outdoor kitchen/BBQ grill.

The upstairs has 5 bedrooms.
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood! It’s got a very relaxed and low key vibe and is in the middle of the forest! We are close to 17 mile drive entrance, Pebble Beach, Asilomar, and the Monterey Aquarium.
host_about: We are a family of five that enjoys traveling, the beach, and a low-key lifestyle. We love hosting  guests atour  A-Frame cabin in Arnold, CA, and enjoy staying in Airbandb's all around the world!

name: Spectacular Award Winning Ocean Front 2 Bed 2 Bath
description:
Award winning historic ocean front home with beautiful Spanish revival decor overlooking Monterey Bay. Gather around the ocean front fire pit and watch whales, seals, sealions, otters, dolphins from the traditional Talavera tiled patio. Ideally situated for walking to Pacific Grove, Cannery Row, Monterey Aquarium and Fisherman's Wharf. Fine dining, bars and shopping are a short stroll away. Convenient access for 17 mile drive, Carmel and Big Sur. A spectacular home in a World famous location.

The space
The lower level of this duplex is a luxury vacation rental offering 2 spacious bedrooms with king size beds and 2 full bathrooms plus a queen size sofabed for additional guests. The unit sleeps up to 6 people and also includes a living/dining room, gourmet kitchen, ocean front patio with fire pit and seating area.
Amenities include high speed internet, WiFi, flat screen TVs in the living room and bedrooms.
Guests especially mention the fabulous views, th
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is described as the last home town in America. It is a charming community which has the largest density of Victorian homes in the Country. Surrounded by the natural wonders of Monterey Bay it is an ideal vacation destination for all that Central California has to offer. It is a paradise for golfers, surfers, divers, cyclists and kayakers.

name: 3118 Nightly Rental - Almost Oceanfront! Walk to Aquarium & Cannery Row!
description:
A stone's throw to Monterey Bay and Recreation Trail. 2437 sf, 4 bedroom, 2.5 bath main house with long term rental guest suite over the garage. Walk to Monterey Bay Aquarium. Three night minimum year round.

Welcome to “Yellow House”, Pacific Grove! Home sleeps up to 8 guests.

Three Night Minimum Stay Year Round.

A dream-come-true vacation home with guest quarters: main house is 2437 square feet, 4 bedroom, 2.5 baths and sleeps 8 in 1 king bed, 2 queen beds and 2 twin beds.

The space
Bright and sunny inside and out, this turn-of-the-century yellow shingled 4-bedroom -- just a stone's throw from the recreation trail leading to the sheltered beach at Lovers Point in Pacific Grove and beyond -- is a vacationer's dream. You're so close to Monterey Bay you can hear the seals bark and watch the waves lap on the rocky shoreline from the living room, dining area and master bedroom.

neighborhood_overview:
Please download our App to obtain our local recommendations and area attractions. Access to the App is automatically provided via email after your reservation is paid in full. You can share this app with all the guests in your party.
Please note that our Good Neighbor Policy is posted in our home and is strictly enforced.
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

description:
Luxury awaits you in this 2,000 s.f. condo with panoramic views of Monterey Bay from the living areas, kitchen, and two of the three bedrooms.

The space
Four-unit condo with off-street parking, walking distance to Cannery Row and downtown Pacific Grove. There is off-street parking for two vehicles. A shared laundry room downstairs offers machines and detergent at no charge.

Other things to note
Available only for 31+ day rental periods, due to City of Pacific Grove restrictions on short-term rentals.

description:
Located only a few blocks from the Aquarium and Cannery Row, this oceanfront property offers sweeping views of the Monterey Bay and surrounding landscape.

Pacific Grove's Coastal Trail is only steps away, and will take you to Lover's Point and Cannery Row where you can explore local restaurants, boutiques and art galleries.

*** Modern kitchen
*** Dining area
*** Garage
*** Laundry appliances.

Please check house rules prior to booking.

Other things to note

Guest is responsible for PG&E (gas and electric) prior to occupancy (29+ Nights Stay). All utilities are included except PG&E. Please establish your account with them prior to your stay.

neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables, a biking and hiking trail running for miles along the oceanfront and spectacular natural scenery.  Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.  Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
The Seven Gables Inn is personally managed by our family. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

Greeting you upon arrival is a complimentary Wine Welcome package with a nice bottle of wine/sparkling cider and fun snacks.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, Susan Flatley Wheelwright, Ed Flatley and JR Wheelwright

name: Charming Villa in Pacific Grove (sleeps 6)
description:
Last minute availability at a great price! Pacific Grove sits on the beautiful California coast between Monterey and Carmel and the unit is a 10 minute walk to the ocean edge. This is a spacious 1 bedroom quiet and private Villa with Queen-size Murphy bed (wall pull-out) and new Lazy Boy Queen sofa-sleeper in living room plus separate bedroom with king and 1 1/4 baths. Full kitchen, wood burning fireplace, plus shared hot tub and barbecue area. 2 large screen TVs. Great for family and friends!

The space
Charming Villa in very private and quiet end-unit in a 14-unit timeshare community. Available for one full week only. Private access to shared outdoor jacuzzi and deck with outdoor seating. Unit was built in the 1940s and is beautifully maintained to retain it's authentic architecture with exposed brick walls, solid wood dutch door, beautiful open beamed ceilings, wood burning fireplace and french doors. neighborhood_overview:
We welcome you to experience the romance of the historic Pacific Grove Inn

The Pacific Grove Inn is a Historic Boutique Inn, that provides charming accommodations with the intimacy of a bed and breakfast. Built-in 1904 and 1908 by Sea Captain Frank LaVerne Buck and Apothecary Joseph Tuttle, these two establishments were remarkably sophisticated for their time and place in Pacific Grove on the Monterey Peninsula and are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

With only 16 hotel rooms and suites, Pacific Grove Inn blends an old world charm with modern day luxury including combinations of fireplaces, private porches, balconies, and entrance with views of the Monterey Bay.

A sanctuary of tranquility and charm awaken your senses with a continental breakfast, unwind in the evening with your fellow guests in the parlor.


Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capi

name: Walking Distance to Beach and Monterey Bay
description:
Welcome to Pacific Gem in Pacific Grove

Conveniently located on Seventeen Mile Drive, Pacific Gem offers guests a two tenth of a mile walk to the beach, Esplanade Park and the Monterey Bay.

From the beach or Esplanade Park, guests may enjoy stunning views of the Pacific Ocean. On clear days, the Santa Cruz mountains beckon from across the vast Monterey Bay. Guest may enjoy watching the sea as yachts, sailboats, fishing boats and whale watching cruises pass by offshore. We have also seen whales breaching and spouting just offshore with the naked eye. And did we mention the spectacular Pacific Sunsets?

Our Pacific Gem is also located conveniently nearby the Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Course, also referred to as “The Public's Pebble Beach”. Your family’s golfer(‘s) can enjoy playing along the north shore of the Monterey Peninsula, or book a round at any of Pebble Beach’s five world class courses on the south and west shores.
neighborhood_overview:
Coast Estate invites you to experience the beautiful Monterey Peninsula and California Central Coast. The are is world renown for spectacular coastlines, unique coastal communities, and rich marine life. Coast Estate specializes in Luxury Vacation Rentals in Big Sur, Carmel, Carmel Highlands, Carmel Valley, Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Monterey and Seaside.

Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capital of California”, due to the annual migration of the Monarch butterflies. Pacific Grove is known for well kept Victorian homes and amazing seascapes along the scenic Sunset Drive.

Asilomar State Beach offers visitors beach and coast trail walks and a short, accessible boardwalk loop through the Asilomar Dunes Natural Preserve. The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continuously operating lighthouse on the West Coast and may be toured in the afternoon. 

Lovers Point Park has becom
host_about:
Our CEO, MaryJane was an executive with the Hyatt for seven years. She chose to leave the work force and stayed home to raise three boys! MaryJane fell into a job I loved, managing a Vacation Rental Company on the Monterey Peninsula and fell in LOVE with the idea of renting homes instead of Hotels. She left the company and started her own business to continue her passion for meeting people near and far and sharing the love of travel.

AirBnb had software problems, and had to recreate several of our listings,  under a second account.

You may see MaryJane's 149 Guest Reviews from the original Host Account.

name: 3119 Yellow House Guest Suite ~ Almost Oceanfront! Walk to Aquarium & Cannery
description:
This unit is a monthly rental. You must arrive by the second of the month, and depart within the same month. Steps from Monterey Bay and recreation trail. This 700 sf one-bedroom sleeps up to 2 adults and 2 children aged 10 & under. King bed in bedroom converts to two twins; queen sofa sleeper in living room. Main house is also available for larger groups.

Welcome to “Yellow House Guest Suite”, Pacific Grove! Guest house sleeps up to 2 adults and 2 children.

The space
Be lulled to sleep at night by the rhythmic sounds of the tide in this cheerful guest house a short walk from Pacific Grove's beautiful Lovers Point. You're so close to Monterey Bay you can hear the seals bark and watch the waves lap on the rocky shoreline from the living room, dining area and master bedroom. The walk to the Monterey Bay Aquarium is an easy 5-10 minute stroll along the beautiful recreation trail. Also walk to restaurants and attractions of both downtown Pacific Grov
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: 3747 Bungalow by-the-Sea ~ Charming Home with Garage, Walk to Town & Beach!
description:
This unit is a monthly rental. You must arrive by the second of the month, and depart within the same month. 2/1, pet friendly, king and king/twin combo

Welcome to “Bungalow-by-the-Sea”! Sleeps 4

A meticulously restored Pacific Grove cottage offers peace, quiet and privacy in a tree-lined neighborhood that is within walking distance of parks, the Monterey Bay Recreation Trail, and downtown restaurants and attractions.

The space
The 2-bedroom, 1-bath 850-square-foot home, built in 1923, has been remodeled to keep all of its historic charm while adding modern conveniences and a beautifully landscaped yard.

Among the many charming features are vintage shutters, plaster walls, an original Carmel stone fireplace, vaulted ceilings, and large windows that let in generous natural light. The coastal/eclectic interiors reflect the nearby beaches in soothing tones of white, driftwood and blue.

The home is just a quick half-mile wa

This fully furnished apartment tucked beneath a vacation rental home offers a longer-term option for living in beautiful Pacific Grove. The 1-bedroom, 1-bath rental is close to everything and yet has a great sense of privacy, surrounded by fencing and ...

The space
...landscaping that hides the home from view.

The 500-square-foot apartment is just a 5-minute walk from shops and restaurants in downtown Pacific Grove, or to the beach and the Monterey Bay Recreational Trail. It’s also a 10-minute walk to Cannery Row and the Monterey Bay Aquarium. The Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Course is just a few minutes' away by car, as is the monarch butterfly sanctuary and Asilomar State Park.

description:
3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms.

Welcome to “The Lavender House”! Sleeps 6

This home has a 3 night minimum stay year round.

Park your car in the garage of this colorful Victorian, and walk to every Pacific Grove attraction from this ideal location right in the heart of town. Dining, shopping, the beach and the Monterey Recreational Trail are just steps away.

Built in 1916, the home was recently renovated to offer modern conveniences along with vintage charm.

The space
Views of the Monterey Bay from its second and third floor bedrooms are fabulous and enhance the experience.

Exquisitely decorated with antique furniture and accessories, it’s like a trip to Pacific Grove’s past, from the old-fashioned front porch to the stained-glass windows.

name: Charming Monterey Bay Home near the Beach
description:
One and a half blocks to the water's edge. Lover's Point and the nearest sandy beach are about 2 blocks further. One block to Lighthouse Ave and downtown where you will find many restaurants. Monterey Bay Aquarium is walkable, about 18 minutes on foot, 20 minutes by car. Pebble Beach, Carmel by the Sea, Monterey Fisherman's Wharf, Cannery Row are nearby, Big Sur is 50 minutes away. Decor is beachy, nautical theme. Safeway supermarket and Trader Joe's are about 8 minutes away by car.

Guest access
Guests may use the entire home and grounds except for the garage.

Other things to note
The 2nd floor has a balcony with a very limited view of the bay.
neighborhood_overview: One and half blocks to the oceanside. Lover's Point and the beach are about 4 blocks away, one block to Lighthouse Avenue, restaurants and downtown area, a movie theater is two blocks away, Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row are a 20 minute walk away. Fisherman's Wharf is a 10 minute drive. Big Sur is roughly a 50  minute drive. Many restaurants to choose from. Safeway supermarket is 8 minutes away as is Trader Joe's.

name: La Piccola Casa "The Little House"   Lic. # 0446
description:
Every house has a story but few are as iconic as La Piccola Casa. Built in early 1900, La Piccola has had a diverse journey. This lovely Victorian lady spent her early years as a Pacific Grove residence before becoming La Piccola Pizzeria & Coffee Shop in 2005. After years of serving thousands of guests, La Piccola has taken on a new life. Lovingly restored by restaurateurs, Joe & Laurie Rombi, she has returned to her roots as a residence while still retaining memories of her culinary past.

The space
La Piccola is an authentic Victorian with all of the modern conveniences and amenities any savvy traveler could want. This two bedroom, two bath cottage has brand new pillow top queen beds, crisp white linens and fluffy bath towels along with individual toiletries. La Piccola comes complete with brand new washer/dryer, utility sink, hair dryers, USB plugs by every nightstand, reverse osmosis drinking water tap, cable television with 60" plasma TV, high speed W
neighborhood_overview:
Just a few short blocks to the ocean, La Piccola is located on one of the most convenient streets in Pacific Grove. She's surrounded by restaurants, coffee shops, a juicery, bakeries, a movie theatre, grocery store and shopping. To name just a few of the amazing eateries on the very same block of 17th Street are La Mia Cucina (best Italian on the Peninsula!), Takara (Sushi) and Fandango (Continental Cuisine). With Grove Market just a stone's throw across the parking lot, all your grocery needs are met without ever getting in the car!

Parking passes will be provided for the lot directly across the street. Please be sure to read the FINE PRINT in the Policies / House Rules Section for more details.

neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove is a popular destination and much appreciated for its cool coastal summer weather & spectacular scenic beauty. This magnificent location continues to entice travelers from around the world for famous attractions such as:

The AT&T Golf Pro-Am
Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance
Monterey Jazz Festival
Laguna Seca Sports Car Championship
Pebble Beach Food and Wine Festival
Pacific Grove Feast of Lanterns
Monterey Fisherman’s Wharf
Monterey Bay Aquarium
Big Sur National Park, plus so much more.

The home is located in a quiet neighborhood, a ten minute drive to Pebble Beach, Spanish Bay or any of the famous golf courses within the gates of 17-Mile Drive. Monterey and Carmel are also just a quick car ride from the home’s location.

name: 3788 Nightly Rental ~ Walk to Downtown and the Beach!
description:
3/2, peeks of bay, pet friendly,

Welcome to “The Seagull’s Nest”! Home sleeps up to 6 guests.

**Please note there is construction work occurring during weekdays on an adjacent building.**

The best of past and present are combined in this historic Victorian cottage in downtown Pacific Grove, within easy walking distance of the beach as well as dining, shopping and the local movie theater. Or you may just want to relax and enjoy views of the bay from the cozy living room, decorated to ...

The space
...reflect the coastal environment.

The blue and white 3-bedroom, 2-bath residence, built in 1905, has been updated to offer modern conveniences while still embracing its vintage roots. The pet-friendly home also has a back patio that is fenced for privacy, a perfect place to enjoy a backyard barbecue or a glass of wine in the evenings.

The home is within walking distance of the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: New! Historic Victorian Cottage Steps to Ocean!

*Please message me with up to the date availability and booking questions*

Really...no dogs.

Charming Queen Anne Victorian steps from the Bay. One of the closest homes to the white sand beaches at Lovers Point, and two blocks from downtown Pacific Grove. The Aquarium is less than a mile down the bay trail. This cottage, built in 1892, exudes charm with original redwood floors, stained glass windows and ornate carved detail. A light, airy beach house, modernized for a relaxing getaway!

The space
*Breathtaking views of Monterey Bay
*Steps from the Ocean
*Steps from the coastal trail
*Bike, kayak, surrey rental at the end of our street
*Ocean views from 3 bedrooms
*Gas Grill on the back patio off the kitchen
*Pack and Play and high chair available
*Outdoor shower
*Very strict no pet policy

There is no driveway or garage at this property; parking is available on the street. Guests are encourag
neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove has dozens of great restaurants, coffee shops, and wine bars—most within a short walk of the house. Lover's Point Beach is steps away, for renting bikes, kayaks and paddling with the harbor seals and sea otters. The recreation trail on the coast is just a few steps away and will take you to all of the sites. Pacific Grove is a great walking and biking town.

Downtown:

* PG Juice and Java for coffee

*There is a Mexican restaurant, ‘Peppers’ 2 blocks up our street that is awesome, a Thai place 4 blocks away on Lighthouse, Pacific Thai Cuisine, (Go up to lighthouse, turn right and it is 2 blocks across the street) that is great.

*Michaels has the best Mexican take out, IL Vecchio on Central Ave is hands down the best Italian Restaurant in town (dine outside or takeout- huge portions and GREAT Cannoli!), Zum Sushi on Central is awesome for takeout as well.

*Asilomar beach for boogie boarding!

*Carmel beach! B

neighborhood_overview:
We welcome you to experience the romance of the historic Pacific Grove Inn

The Pacific Grove Inn is a Historic Boutique Inn, that provides charming accommodations with the intimacy of a bed and breakfast. Built-in 1904 and 1908 by Sea Captain Frank LaVerne Buck and Apothecary Joseph Tuttle, these two establishments were remarkably sophisticated for their time and place in Pacific Grove on the Monterey Peninsula and are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

With only 16 hotel rooms and suites, Pacific Grove Inn blends an old world charm with modern day luxury including combinations of fireplaces, private porches, balconies, and entrance with views of the Monterey Bay.

A sanctuary of tranquility and charm awaken your senses with a continental breakfast, unwind in the evening with your fellow guests in the parlor.

A sweet bungalow with vintage character inside and out awaits guests in Pacific Grove, with a fully fenced yard that offers plenty of space for outdoor fun, and is also just steps from the downtown area, the beach and the Monterey Bay Recreation Trail.

The space
This 2-bedroom, 1-bath house, built in 1930 but recently remodeled, is just a few blocks from shopping and fine dining in Pacific Grove, and is also close to the town’s Museum of Natural History and Lovers Point. It’s a short walk to the nearby Monarch butterfly sanctuary and Point Pinos Lighthouse, or just 10 minutes' by car to the world-class golf courses and restaurants of Pebble Beach® or to the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row.

description:
A stroll, a kiss, a feeling, a sound, a sunset shared.

Retreat to the Pacific coast and experience a breath of fresh ocean air at this quaint Victorian boutique Inn. Centrella Inn has been a peaceful, romantic retreat destination of choice for charm and romance since 1889.

Ideally located: 2 minute walk to Lover’s Point & beach. 15 minutes walk to world-famous Monterey Bay Aquarium and historic Cannery Row. Close to Pebble Beach, Carmel and Big Sur.

Select Cottages are Pet friendly.

The space
These are individual cottages around a Victorian garden with a Master bedroom and a separate living room.

They have fireplaces, wet bar, mini fridge, clawfoot tub bath, TV, dining table and a sofa-bed.

The Cottages can accomodate families with children. The Cottages are ideal choice for guests seeking privacy in a cozy and intimate setting for a quiet retreat.

Rates are based on double occupancy. $40 per
neighborhood_overview:
Ideal location in a peaceful & charming neighborhood.

- 1 block from Pacific Grove downtown with many romantic restaurant, wine tasting rooms, cafes and boutique shops.

- 2 minute walk to Lover's Point Beach (one of the most popular beaches on the Monterey Peninsula) and coastal recreational trails.

- 10 minutes walk along the coastal recreational trail to the world-renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row.

- 5 minutes drive to Pebble Beach & 17-Mile Drive.

- Short drive to Carmel by the Sea and world famous Highway 1 to Big Sur.

There is a partial horizon ocean view from the bedroom.

This Suite cannot accomodate children age 9 and under.

Ideal location in a peaceful & charming neighborhood.

- 1 block from Pacific Grove downtown with many romantic restaurant, wine tasting rooms, cafes and boutique shops.

- 2 minute walk to Lover's Point Beach (one of the most popular beaches on the Monterey Peninsula) and coastal recreational trails.

- 10 minutes walk along the coastal recreational trail to the world-renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row.

- 5 minutes drive to Pebble Beach & 17-Mile Drive.

- Short drive to Carmel by the Sea and world famous Highway 1 to Big Sur.

name: Lovely Forest Home on One Acre in Pacific Grove
description:
Clean and spacious 2 bedroom, 2 bath home in beautiful Pacific Grove, CA. Accommodates 4 adults and 2+ children. Queen bed in master bedroom, Full bed in second bedroom, Pull-out queen sofa bed in living room. 10 min. walk to beautiful Asilomar Beach with white sand, gorgeous views, and amazing dog beach. Located between Monterey and Carmel on a large (1 acre) forested lot with fire pit and outdoor dining. Just a few min. drive to the entrance gate of scenic, 17 Mile Drive. Pet friendly.

The space
This ultra clean home is turn-key ready for your stay. It is fully stocked with everything that you will need for cooking, towels and bedding, and bathroom convenience items. It is truly a home away from home on a gorgeous 1 acre forest lot. It has excellent cable and wifi services, a very large and comfortable living room with lots of seating, updated features and designer touches and television in the bedrooms and living room. Outside is a dining patio with a barbequ
neighborhood_overview: The house is set back from the road and is very quiet and peaceful.  There are nature trails and walks nearby, including the beautiful coastal path along Oceanview Ave. It is a short five minute drive to the restaurants and shops at Cannery Row, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, and another few minutes from there to the Monterey Wharf.  It is close to all of the attractions on the Monterey Peninsula, yet tucked into a sleepy forest neighborhood. At night you can sit at the firepit and stargaze while listening to the ocean waves washing ashore. It is truly amazing!
host_about: We fell in love with Pacific Grove while attending the annual Monterey Car week in 2015. We purchased two PG homes later that year, and last year we obtained a short term rental license for the cottage house. We live in Santa Clarita, CA with our 9 year old daughter. We stay in Pacific Grove as often as possible : )

name: Spectacular Views - Walk to Cannery Row and the Aquarium
description:
Welcome to Monterey's Bay Views!

Due to City of Monterey Ordnance, all leases require a 31-night minimum.

Bay Views is a contemporary four (4) bedroom, two (2) bath home. Upon arriving, Guests are treated to panoramic views of the Monterey Bay. You may see the expansive Monterey Bay views throughout the house and soak up sun plus the best of the views on a private deck.

A convenient location puts you close to everything! The Monterey Bay Aquarium is just down the street, while a convenience store, grocery store, pizzeria, and the famous Cannery Row shops and restaurants are all walking distance from your rental.

Whale watching tours, the world renown golf courses of Pebble Beach, sandy beaches, oceanside walks and the Monterey- Pacific Grove Recreation path are all within minutes.

Natural light and bay views await in a fantastic entertaining space on the main floor. Updated furnishings and appliances include a c
neighborhood_overview:
The Monterey Peninsula is different than any other part of California. Here, time slows, the architecture is humble (with the exception of the homes in Pebble Beach), and the lifestyle is the perfect synthesis of SoCal laid back and NorCal sophisticated. On the northern side of the peninsula, the town of Monterey draws most of the tourists, while farther south, Carmel-by-the-Sea lures the easygoing wealthy set. Tremendous price tags on real estate helps maintain the small-community atmosphere along Monterey's jaw-dropping coastline.

This area makes for a tremendous road-trip stop or romantic weekend stay. And did we mention the golf courses? This stretch of the California coastline boasts some of the most coveted fairways in the world. Add to than an abundance of natural wonders, luxury resorts and seafood restaurants, and Monterey might just be the ideal destination for your next getaway.
host_about:
Our CEO, MaryJane was an executive with the Hyatt for seven years. She chose to leave the work force and stayed home to raise three boys! MaryJane fell into a job I loved, managing a Vacation Rental Company on the Monterey Peninsula and fell in LOVE with the idea of renting homes instead of Hotels. She left the company and started her own business to continue her passion for meeting people near and far and sharing the love of travel.

AirBnb had software problems, and had to recreate several of our listings,  under a second account.

You may see MaryJane's 149 Guest Reviews from the original Host Account.

This is a micro studio with its own entrance and has a peek-a-boo view of the ocean. This unit sleeps two comfortably with a daybed and pull out trundle The kitchen comes complete with a microwave, mini-fridge, induction cooktop, and Keurig coffee and tea maker.

Welcome to Hillcrest!



This updated Pacific Grove home shows pride of ownership and lots of extras! There is room for everyone in this 4 bed, 2.5 bath home with over 2067 square feet of living space.

Hillcrest features an open kitchen, living room and dining area that bask in the sunshine and welcome you to this very special home.

The updated kitchen, remodeled bath, new flooring are just a few recent upgrades! Close to Pacific Grove's  downtown stores and resturaunts.

Your hosts have provided the services of Carmel Coast Estate, Inc a locally owned and operated full service Real Estate and Property Management company. Your Property Managers are available by cellular phone, text messaging and email during your visit.

Here at Carmel Coast Estate, we take every measure to ensu
neighborhood_overview:
Coast Estate invites you to experience the beautiful Monterey Peninsula and California Central Coast. The are is world renown for spectacular coastlines, unique coastal communities, and rich marine life. Coast Estate specializes in Luxury Vacation Rentals in Big Sur, Carmel, Carmel Highlands, Carmel Valley, Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Monterey and Seaside.

Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capital of California”, due to the annual migration of the Monarch butterflies. Pacific Grove is known for well kept Victorian homes and amazing seascapes along the scenic Sunset Drive.

Asilomar State Beach offers visitors beach and coast trail walks and a short, accessible boardwalk loop through the Asilomar Dunes Natural Preserve. The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continuously operating lighthouse on the West Coast and may be toured in the afternoon.

name: Seagull House with views from Sunrise to Sunset
description:
We offer serenity above Monterey Bay. Enjoy the peace, quiet and views of our Penthouse three stories above downtown Pacific Grove. Views from sunrise to sunset. Walk to Lovers Point beach four blocks down the hill past the Monday farmers market. Private entry with elevator and serene contemporary decor. We call our space Seagull house on Grand and hope you create memories to last a lifetime.

The space
Our flat is the perfect solution for luxury and peace. Pacific Grove STR licence #0438. Our third story respite rivals our local high end hotel suites with the added benefit of privacy, views, kitchen and guest room. Park your car a block away in the 24 hour lot and walk to the beach, coastal trails and everything downtown Pacific Grove has to offer.

Guest access
You will have access to your flat through a shared entry room and elevator with our tenants who live on the second floor. There is a code on the door of this unit to insure privacy.
neighborhood_overview: We are nearly in the center of downtown Pacific Grove. Our street leads directly down to Lovers Point Beach and the walking/bike coastal trail along our beautiful peninsula. A block away enjoy restaurants, shops and art. The grocery store, Grove Market is a block away as well as our famous Pavel's bakery. Go early on Saturday as the line is out the door and up the street. We have a fantastic Barber shop, art supply store, vinyl record shop and historical museum. The Monterey Bay Aquarium is a 20 minute walk along the ocean and historic Cannery Row and The Wharf are all in walking distance. We love our location and hope you will too.
host_about: Coastal Californian. Lover of travel, design, art, music, film, garden, food and many other forms of creativity. We design and build for a living in Pacific Grove between Monterey and Carmel. Weekends are spent hiking in Big Sur or Marin, exploring San Francisco, surfing in Santa Cruz and annual trips to the Sawtooth mountains in Idaho to ride Peruvian Paso's with family friends. Hard work pays off.

name: 3812 Nightly Rental ~ Charming Historical Home Just Steps to the Coast Trail!
description:
3/2, pet friendly, Cal K, Q, 2T, walk to beach,

Welcome to “Little House”! Sleeps 6

A sweet Victorian home in Pacific Grove, just steps from the beach and the Monterey Bay Recreation Trail, is the perfect place to bring your family to relax and unwind, close enough to hear the waves and hear the seagulls crying in the distance.

The Little House, built in 1888, is a registered Pacific Grove Historic Home and has vintage charm inside and out while also offering modern conveniences.

The space
Pet-friendly with a fenced back yard, it’s set up for every member of the family.

The 3-bedroom, 2-bath home features stained glass windows and other classic Victorian details, as well as original hardwood floors and light fixtures, lovely antique furniture, historic photographs and other vintage details.

Besides being just steps from the beach, the 1,400-square-foot house is also only a few minutes' away from Monarch butte
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables, a biking and hiking trail running for miles along the oceanfront and spectacular natural scenery.  Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.  Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
The Seven Gables Inn is personally managed by our family. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

Greeting you upon arrival is a complimentary Wine Welcome package with a nice bottle of wine/sparkling cider and fun snacks.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, Susan Flatley Wheelwright, Ed Flatley and JR Wheelwright

neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables, a biking and hiking trail running for miles along the oceanfront and spectacular natural scenery.  Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.  Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
The Seven Gables Inn is personally managed by our family. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

Greeting you upon arrival is a complimentary Wine Welcome package with a nice bottle of wine/sparkling cider and fun snacks.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, Susan Flatley Wheelwright, Ed Flatley and JR Wheelwright

name: 3684 Jewel by the Sea ~ Updated, Luxurious, Walk to Town and the Beach
description:
This unit is a monthly rental. You must arrive by the second of the month, and depart within the same month. One block from downtown Pacific Grove lies this gorgeous 2,150 sf, 4 bedroom, 3 bath home that sleeps up to 8 adults and 2 children age 12 or under. Freshly renovated throughout, this home boasts top of the line fixtures and amenities.

Welcome to Jewel by the Sea!

With the look of Old California on the outside and stylish elegance inside, this 4-bedroom, 3-bath home in the heart of ...

The space
...Pacific Grove has the best of everything in one place. Luxurious touches like surround sound, quilted maple hardwood floors, and Italian marble counter tops make it a one-of-kind vacation experience.

Located just steps away from the shops and restaurants of downtown Pacific Grove, the residence is an easy walk to the beach, golfing and the Monarch Butterfly groves. Just a few blocks away, the bay has kayaking, boating and hik
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: 3817 Caledonia Bay Lookout - Perfect Family Retreat Near Bay, Park and Town
description:
3/2.5, Cal K, Q, 2 Tw, across street from Caledonia park, dog friendly with fee and with Owner advanced approval

Welcome to Caledonia Bay Lookout!

This unique three-level home overlooks Caledonia Park and is located just 2 blocks from both downtown Pacific Grove restaurants and attractions as well as the bay and Lover's Point Beach. A peek-a-boo view of Monterey Bay may be seen from the upper bedroom and the kitchen area.

The space
Totally updated interior with all new beds and furnishings. A perfect family retreat. Well-behaved dogs are welcome with an additional fee upon advanced Homeowner approval.

Maximum Occupancy: This home sleeps up to 6 guests.

Lower Level Sleeping Options (Ground floor level of a three-level home/entry level)

Bedroom #1
Queen Bed

Bedroom #2
Twin Day Bed
OR
Two Twin Beds

Note: The bedrooms on this lower level share a full bath accessed

name: 3816 Casita Mariposa - Live and Work in Pacific Grove this Summer!
description:
This unit is a monthly rental. You must arrive by the second of the month, and depart within the same month. 3/2, Q, Q, Q sleeper sofa, only 1 TV in 3rd bedroom, no pets,

Welcome to “Casita Mariposa”! Sleeps 6

With the beach and municipal golf course just steps away, it will be hard to decide which way to go while staying in this colorful Pacific Grove home. But you may want to just stay to lounge on the front patio, glimpse sailboats and spouting whales on the bay, and hear crashing waves ...

The space
...and seagull cries in the distance.

The single-level, newly renovated 3-bedroom, 2-bath home features garden patios both front and back, with thoughtful design inside and out that includes custom-made stained glass windows, bathrooms with curbless showers and heated floors, a fully equipped kitchen with beverage refrigerator, and a natural gas fireplace with remote and cool touch technology for safety.

Vaulted ceilings
